Description: Glazed steatite scarab, elytra marked, striated legs, pierced longitudinally, base inscribed with hieroglyphs.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Matches Hogarth's description of one of the scarabs found in the loose dark earth outside Tomb I.
Bibliographic references: Ryan 1988 / The Archaeological Excavations of David George Hogarth at Asyut, Egypt 1906/7 (10)
